description: TestRail helps you manage and track your software testing efforts and organize your QA department. Its intuitive web-based user interface makes it easy to create test cases, manage test runs and coordinate your entire testing process.
steps: After registration, create api key in account settings.
After creation api key,API can be enabled in the administration area in TestRail under Administration > Site Settings > API.
You can get appName from url.For example rapidtest  https://rapidtest.testrail.io

blocks.name: getCase
blocks.description: Use the following API method to request details about test case.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: caseId
args.info: The ID of the test case.

blocks.name: getCases
blocks.description: Returns a list of test cases for a test suite or specific section in a test suite.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: suiteId
args.info: The ID of the test suite (optional if the project is operating in single suite mode).

args.name: sectionId
args.info: The ID of the section (optional).

args.name: createdAfter
args.info: Only return test cases created after this date.

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Only return test cases created before this date.

args.name: createdBy
args.info: List of creators (user IDs) to filter by.

args.name: milestoneId

structure.name: milestoneId
structure.info: Single milestone IDs to filter by.

args.info: List of milestone IDs to filter by (not available if the milestone field is disabled for the project).

args.name: priorityId

structure.name: priorityId
structure.info: Single priority IDs to filter by.

args.info: List of priority IDs to filter by.

args.name: typeId

structure.name: caseTypeId
structure.info: Single case type IDs to filter by.

args.info: List of case type IDs to filter by.

args.name: templateId

structure.name: templateId
structure.info: Single template IDs to filter by.

args.info: List of template IDs to filter by.(requires TestRail 5.2 or later)

args.name: updatedAfter
args.info: Only return test cases updated after this date.

args.name: updatedBefore
args.info: Only return test cases updated before this date.

args.name: updatedBy
args.info: List of users who updated test cases to filter by.

blocks.name: createCase
blocks.description: Creates a new test case.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: sectionId
args.info: The ID of the section the test case should be added to.

args.name: title
args.info: The title of the test case (required)

args.name: templateId
args.info: The ID of the template (field layout) (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: typeId
args.info: The ID of the case type.

args.name: estimate
args.info: The estimate, e.g. `30s` or `1m 45s`.

args.name: priorityId
args.info: The ID of the case priority.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test case.

args.name: refs
args.info: List of references/requirements.

args.name: customFields

structure.name: value
structure.info: Json value of the custom field.

args.info: Custom fields are supported as well and must be submitted with their system name, prefixed with 'custom_'.See more in readme.

blocks.name: updateCase
blocks.description: Updates an existing test case (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: caseId
args.info: The ID of the test case

args.name: title
args.info: The title of the test case (required)

args.name: templateId
args.info: The ID of the template (field layout) (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: typeId
args.info: The ID of the case type.

args.name: estimate
args.info: The estimate, e.g. `30s` or `1m 45s`.

args.name: priorityId
args.info: The ID of the case priority.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test case.

args.name: refs
args.info: List of references/requirements.

args.name: customFields

structure.name: value
structure.info: Json value of the custom field.

args.info: Custom fields are supported as well and must be submitted with their system name, prefixed with 'custom_'.See more in readme.

blocks.name: deleteCase
blocks.description: Deletes an existing test case.Please note: Deleting a test case cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all test results in active test runs (i.e. test runs that haven't been closed (archived) yet).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: caseId
args.info: The ID of the test case.

blocks.name: getAllCaseFields
blocks.description: Returns a list of available test case custom fields.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

blocks.name: getAllCaseTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of available case types.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

blocks.name: getProjectConfigs
blocks.description: Returns a list of available configurations, grouped by configuration groups (requires TestRail 3.1 or later).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

blocks.name: createNewConfigurationGroup
blocks.description: Creates a new configuration group (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project the configuration group should be added to.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the configuration group (required).

blocks.name: updateConfigGroup
blocks.description: Updates an existing configuration group (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: configGroupId
args.info: The ID of the configuration group.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the configuration group.

blocks.name: createNewConfiguration
blocks.description: Creates a new configuration (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: configGroupId
args.info: The ID of the configuration group the configuration should be added to.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the configuration (required).

blocks.name: updateConfig
blocks.description: Updates an existing configuration (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: configId
args.info: The ID of the configuration.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the configuration.

blocks.name: deleteConfigGroup
blocks.description: Deletes an existing configuration group and its configurations (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).Please note: Deleting a configuration group cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all configurations in this group. It does not, however, affect closed test plans/runs, or active test plans/runs unless they are updated.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: configGroupId
args.info: The ID of the configuration group.

blocks.name: deleteConfig
blocks.description: Deletes an existing configuration (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).Please note: Deleting a configuration cannot be undone. It does not, however, affect closed test plans/runs, or active test plans/runs unless they are updated.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: configId
args.info: The ID of the configuration.

blocks.name: getMilestone
blocks.description: Returns an existing milestone.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone.

blocks.name: getMilestones
blocks.description: Returns the list of milestones for a project.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: 1 to return completed milestones only. 0 to return open (active/upcoming) milestones only (available since TestRail 4.0).

args.name: isStarted
args.info: 1 to return started milestones only. 0 to return upcoming milestones only (available since TestRail 5.3).

blocks.name: createsMilestone
blocks.description: Creates a new milestone.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project the milestone should be added to.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the milestone (required).

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the milestone.

args.name: dueOn
args.info: The due date of the milestone.

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent milestone, if any (for sub-milestones) (available since TestRail 5.3).

args.name: startOn
args.info: The scheduled start date of the milestone.

blocks.name: updateMilestone
blocks.description: Updates an existing milestone (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone.

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: True if a milestone is considered completed and false otherwise.

args.name: isStarted
args.info: True if a milestone is considered started and false otherwise.

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent milestone, if any (for sub-milestones) (available since TestRail 5.3).

args.name: startOn
args.info: The scheduled start date of the milestone.

blocks.name: deleteMilestone
blocks.description: Deletes an existing milestone.Please note: Deleting a milestone cannot be undone.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone.

blocks.name: getPlan
blocks.description: Returns an existing test plan.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the test plan.

blocks.name: getPlans
blocks.description: Returns a list of test plans for a project.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: createdAfter
args.info: Only return test plans created after this date.

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Only return test plans created before this date.

args.name: createdBy
args.info: List of creators (user IDs) to filter by.

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: 1 to return completed test plans only. 0 to return active test plans only.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result to :limit test plans.

args.name: offset
args.info: Use :offset to skip records.

args.name: milestoneId

structure.name: milestoneId
structure.info: Single milestone IDs to filter by.

args.info: List of milestone IDs to filter by.

blocks.name: createPlan
blocks.description: Creates a new test plan.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project the test plan should be added to.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test plan (required).

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test plan.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test plan.

args.name: entries
args.info: An json array of objects describing the test runs of the plan.See more in readme.

blocks.name: createPlanEntry
blocks.description: Adds one or more new test runs to a test plan.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the project the test plan should be added to.

args.name: suiteId
args.info: The ID of the test suite for the test run(s).

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test run.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test run(s) (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: assignedtoId
args.info: The ID of the user the test run(s) should be assigned to.

args.name: includeAll
args.info: True for including all test cases of the test suite and false for a custom case selection (default: true).

args.name: caseIds
args.info: An array of case IDs for the custom case selection.

args.name: configIds
args.info: An array of configuration IDs used for the test runs of the test plan entry (requires TestRail 3.1 or later).

args.name: runs
args.info: An array of configuration IDs used for the test runs of the test plan entry (requires TestRail 3.1 or later).See more in readme.

blocks.name: updatePlan
blocks.description: Updates an existing test plan (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the project the test plan should be added to.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test run.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test run(s) (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test plan.

args.name: entries
args.info: An json array of objects describing the test runs of the plan.See more in readme.

blocks.name: updatePlanEntry
blocks.description: Updates one or more existing test runs in a plan (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the project the test plan should be added to.

args.name: entryId
args.info: The ID of the test plan entry (note: not the test run ID)

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test run.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test run(s) (requires TestRail 5.2 or later).

args.name: assignedtoId
args.info: The ID of the user the test run(s) should be assigned to.

args.name: includeAll
args.info: True for including all test cases of the test suite and false for a custom case selection (default: true)

args.name: caseIds
args.info: An array of case IDs for the custom case selection.

blocks.name: closePlan
blocks.description: Closes an existing test plan and archives its test runs & results.Please note: Closing a test plan cannot be undone.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the plan.

blocks.name: deletePlan
blocks.description: Deletes an existing test plan.Please note: Deleting a test plan cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all test runs & results of the test plan.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the plan.

blocks.name: deletePlanEntry
blocks.description: Deletes one or more existing test runs from a plan.Please note: Deleting a test run from a plan cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all related test results.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the plan.

args.name: entryId
args.info: The ID of the test plan entry (note: not the test run ID).

blocks.name: getAllPriorities
blocks.description: Returns a list of available priorities.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

blocks.name: getProject
blocks.description: Returns an existing project.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

blocks.name: getProjects
blocks.description: Returns the list of available projects.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: 1 to return completed projects only. 0 to return active projects only.

blocks.name: createProject
blocks.description: Creates a new project (admin status required).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the project (required).

args.name: announcement
args.info: The description of the project.

args.name: showAnnouncement
args.info: True if the announcement should be displayed on the project's overview page and false otherwise.

args.name: suiteMode
args.info: The suite mode of the project (1 for single suite mode, 2 for single suite + baselines, 3 for multiple suites) (added with TestRail 4.0).

blocks.name: updateProject
blocks.description: Updates an existing project (admin status required; partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The name of the project (required).

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: Specifies whether a project is considered completed or not.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the project (required).

args.name: announcement
args.info: The description of the project.

args.name: showAnnouncement
args.info: True if the announcement should be displayed on the project's overview page and false otherwise.

args.name: suiteMode
args.info: The suite mode of the project (1 for single suite mode, 2 for single suite + baselines, 3 for multiple suites) (added with TestRail 4.0).

blocks.name: deleteProject
blocks.description: Deletes an existing project (admin status required).Please note: Deleting a project cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all test suites & cases, test runs & results and everything else that is part of the project.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

blocks.name: getResults
blocks.description: Returns a list of test results for a test.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: testId
args.info: The ID of the test.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result to :limit test plans.

args.name: offset
args.info: Use :offset to skip records.

args.name: statusId
args.info: List of status IDs to filter by.

blocks.name: getResultsForCase
blocks.description: Returns a list of test results for a test run and case combination.See more in readme.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

args.name: caseId
args.info: The ID of the test case

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result to :limit test plans.

args.name: offset
args.info: Use :offset to skip records.

args.name: statusId
args.info: List of status IDs to filter by.

blocks.name: getResultsForRun
blocks.description: Returns a list of test results for a test run.Requires TestRail 4.0 or later.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

args.name: createdAfter
args.info: Only return test results created after this date.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result to :limit test plans.

args.name: offset
args.info: Use :offset to skip records.

args.name: statusId
args.info: List of status IDs to filter by.

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Only return test results created before this date.

args.name: createdBy
args.info: List of creators (user IDs) to filter by.

blocks.name: addResults
blocks.description: Adds one or more new test results, comments or assigns one or more tests. Ideal for test automation to bulk-add multiple test results in one step.See more in readme.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run the results should be added to.

args.name: resultJsonStructure
args.info: List of the json results objects.

blocks.name: addResultsForCases
blocks.description: Adds one or more new test results, comments or assigns one or more tests (using the case IDs). Ideal for test automation to bulk-add multiple test results in one step.See more in readme.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run the results should be added to.

args.name: resultJsonStructure
args.info: List of the json results objects.

blocks.name: addResult
blocks.description: Adds a new test result, comment or assigns a test. It's recommended to use add_results instead if you plan to add results for multiple tests.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: testId
args.info: The ID of the test.

args.name: statusId
args.info: You can get a full list of system and custom statuses via getStatuses.

args.name: comment
args.info: The comment / description for the test result.

args.name: version
args.info: The version or build you tested against.

args.name: elapsed
args.info: The time it took to execute the test, e.g. `30s` or `1m 45s`

args.name: defects
args.info: List of defects to link to the test result.

args.name: assignedToId
args.info: The ID of a user the test should be assigned to.

args.name: customFields

structure.name: value
structure.info: Json value of the custom field.

args.info: Custom fields are supported as well and must be submitted with their system name, prefixed with 'custom_'.See more in readme.

blocks.name: addResultForCase
blocks.description: Adds a new test result, comment or assigns a test (for a test run and case combination). It's recommended to use add_results_for_cases instead if you plan to add results for multiple test cases.See more in readme.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

args.name: caseId
args.info: The ID of the case run.

args.name: statusId
args.info: You can get a full list of system and custom statuses via getStatuses.

args.name: comment
args.info: The comment / description for the test result.

args.name: version
args.info: The version or build you tested against.

args.name: elapsed
args.info: The time it took to execute the test, e.g. `30s` or `1m 45s`

args.name: defects
args.info: List of defects to link to the test result.

args.name: assignedToId
args.info: The ID of a user the test should be assigned to.

args.name: customFields

structure.name: value
structure.info: Json value of the custom field.

args.info: Custom fields are supported as well and must be submitted with their system name, prefixed with 'custom_'.See more in readme.

blocks.name: getResultFields
blocks.description: Returns a list of available test result custom fields.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

blocks.name: getRun
blocks.description: Returns an existing test run. Please see getTests for the list of included tests in this run.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

blocks.name: createTestRun
blocks.description: Creates a new test run.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: suiteId
args.info: The ID of the test suite for the test run (optional if the project is operating in single suite mode, required otherwise).

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test run.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test run.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test run.

args.name: assignedToId
args.info: The ID of the user the test run should be assigned to.

args.name: includeAll
args.info: True for including all test cases of the test suite and false for a custom case selection (default: true).

args.name: caseIds
args.info: An array of case IDs for the custom case selection.

blocks.name: updateTestRun
blocks.description: Updates an existing test run (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the test run.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the test run.

args.name: milestoneId
args.info: The ID of the milestone to link to the test run.

args.name: includeAll
args.info: True for including all test cases of the test suite and false for a custom case selection (default: true).

args.name: caseIds
args.info: An array of case IDs for the custom case selection.

blocks.name: closeRun
blocks.description: Closes an existing test run and archives its tests & results.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

blocks.name: deleteRun
blocks.description: Deletes an existing test run.Please note: Deleting a test run cannot be undone and also permanently deletes all tests & results of the test run.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: runId
args.info: The ID of the test run.

args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: suiteId
args.info: The ID of the test suite (optional if the project is operating in single suite mode).

blocks.name: createSection
blocks.description: Creates a new section.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the section (added with TestRail 4.0).

args.name: suiteId
args.info: The ID of the test suite (ignored if the project is operating in single suite mode, required otherwise).

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent section (to build section hierarchies).

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the section (required).

blocks.name: updateSection
blocks.description: Updates an existing section (partial updates are supported, i.e. you can submit and update specific fields only).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: sectionId
args.info: The ID of the section.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the section (added with TestRail 4.0).

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the section.

blocks.name: deleteSection
blocks.description: Deletes an existing section.Please note: Deleting a section cannot be undone and also deletes all related test cases as well as active tests & results, i.e. tests & results that weren't closed (archived) yet.

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.info: The ID of the section.

blocks.name: getRuns
blocks.description: Returns a list of test runs for a project. Only returns those test runs that are not part of a test plan (please see get_plans/get_plan for this).

args.name: appName
args.info: Your app name. Example - rapidtest.testrail.io

args.name: username
args.info: Your username.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API Key.Also you can use account password.

args.name: projectId
args.info: The ID of the project.

args.name: createdAfter
args.info: Only return test runs created after this date.

args.name: createdBefore
args.info: Only return test runs created before this date.

args.name: createdBy
args.info: List of creators (user IDs) to filter by.

args.name: isCompleted
args.info: 1 to return completed runs only. 0 to return open (active/upcoming) milestones only (available since TestRail 4.0).

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result to :limit test plans.

args.name: offset
args.info: Use :offset to skip records.

args.name: milestoneId

structure.name: milestoneId
structure.info: Single milestone IDs to filter by.

args.info: A list of milestone IDs to filter by.

args.name: suiteId

structure.name: suiteId
structure.info: Single suite IDs to filter by.

args.info: A list of test suite IDs to filter by.
